author: Staff Reporter
text:
Stating that hijacking of copper-laden lorries and stealing of goods which were high in Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh has started to occur in Tamil Nadu, StateLorry Owners’ Federation – Tamil Nadu, has urged the State government to take steps to prevent it.

Speaking to reporters here on Monday, its president M.R. Kumaraswamy said that on March 11, a copper-laden lorry was hijacked near Aravakurichi check post in Karur district and the driver was attacked.

While the attackers tried to disconnect the GPS device, the lorry engine stopped. But, they brought another lorry and shifted the goods to it.

However, the police who are on patrol arrested them. In February also, a five-member gang attempted to hijack a lorry near Aravakurichi, he added.

He said that 25 drivers from Tamil Nadu have so far been murdered and 12 lorries were stolen.

“The State government should ensure safety of drivers and the property and the gang involved in these incidents should be arrested”, he added.

The association president said that Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) have decided to hike the premium rates for motor third party liability insurance covers by 20 to 30 per cent.

“The IRDAI should give up the proposal”, he added. Mr. Kumarasamy also said that Kerala Government should improve the facilities in Walayar check post at the earliest failing which decision would be taken up during the executive committee meeting of the All India Motor Congress in Coimbatore on March 18.
title: Association seeks security for truck drivers
